page.title: 18SHOPPING
page.content: There is a small post-office/grocery {shop}in Belchamp St.Paul but most people tend to do the bulk of their shopping in Clare or the{supermarkets in Sudbury, Bury St.Edmunds, Haverhill and as far as Cambridge or Ipswich. The{bus}runs from the village to Sudbury on Tuesday,Thursday and Saturday but most families have a{car. There are two{taxis.}Some people grow their own vegetables. There are a few allotments for those without a garden. Some people keep chickens for eggs. Some sell flowers and fruit.{Bread}is deivered daily to the shop. There is a mobile fish and vegetable van once a week & daily deliveries of post,{milk and newspapers. Coal and heating oil is also delivered.A mobile library calls weekly.The{Doctor's Surgery}and nearest{chemist}is in Clare, & the nearest{hospitals}- Sudbury or Bury.
